Name: Kiraly, Michael A
Program_Name: CIHR Fellowship
Project_Title: Antioxidant drugs protect b-cells from oxidative stress caused by hyperglycemia. Nonetheless small concentrations of reactive oxygen species support the insulin secretory response to glucose. b-cells contain superoxide dismutase but not catalase or glutathione peroxidase. This suggests b-cells may lack a peroxidase defense so that during physiologic situations low levels of H2O2 are developed to support insulin gene expression/secretion. My studies will examine regulation of glucose-induced insulin secretion by intracellular H2O2 and the possible adverse consequences on b-cell function of excess H2O2 catabolism by antioxidant drugs
